title: Discretionary revocation or suspension of license by a court
context: §286-125 Discretionary revocation or suspension of license by a court. In addition to the provisions for mandatory revocation of a license set forth in section 286-124, any court of competent jurisdiction may, in its discretion, revoke or suspend the license of any driver convicted of any felony in the commission of which a motor vehicle is used, or convicted of a violation of this part or of any traffic law or regulation of the State or any political subdivision thereof involving a vehicle in motion. [L 1937, c 234, §23; RL 1945, §7324; RL 1955, §160-56; HRS §286-125; am L 1970, c 164, §3; am L 1971, c 171, §2] Case Notes As §291C-161&copy; requires every person convicted under §291C-105 to be sentenced in accordance with §291C-105, trial court erred in sentencing defendant to a six-month driver&rsquo;s license suspension under this section; the plain language of §291C-105 required the sentencing court to impose the list of sanctions as specific under §291C-105&copy;, including a thirty-day license suspension for a first-time offender. 121 H. 117 (App.), 214 P.3d 1107 (2009).
